titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that a postage stamp should be issued honoring Oskar Schindler.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that a postage stamp should be issued honoring Oskar Schindler.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the Senate that the Postal Service should issue a stamp honoring the life of Oskar Schindler who, during the Nazi occupation of Poland, personally risked his life and that of his wife to provide food and medical care and saved the lives of over 1,000 Jews.
